heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded was on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 04 September 2025 and lasted 1 days.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (181°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 53.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded was 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 3.1°C) and outside temperature (down 2.0°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 6%).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 6.3°C), inside temperature (up 1.7°C), and dew point temperature (up 2.5°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 455.3m lower than yesterday, 69.0m higher than the past week, 816.8m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 835m to a maximum of 3910m, averaging 1730.0m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1661.0m and 2550m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Expect mostly clear skies with high cloud.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; temperatures should feel nicely warm. Also, air moisture should feel ok and very little to no wind will be present. Showers, mostly clear skies with high cloud, and sunlight will be very intense and bright. Weather patterns to stay the same.
